intro: Gayophytum diffusum var. typicum, commonly known as the velvetleaf. This plant is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
